name: atrophic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of tissue or an organ in the body) having atrophied (= become smaller or thinner and weaker): These changes were more noticeable in the atrophic right kidney than in the left kidney. The mucosa of the stomach was atrophic.
(of a disease or condition) relating to tissue or an organ in the body that becomes smaller or thinner and weaker: High salt intake can induce atrophic gastritis, a chronic inflammation and thinning of the stomach lining. Atrophic rhinitis is nasal dryness that occurs when tissue inside of your nose thins or atrophies. Related word
atrophy
